meanings.definition: To surpass in pulling or drawing out.
meanings.sent1: The strong man was able to outpull all his competitors in the tug-of-war.
meanings.sent2: She tried to outpull the stubborn cork from the bottle, but it wouldn't budge.
meanings.sent3: The little ant thought it could outpull the big elephant in a game of tug-of-war.
meanings.sent4: The determined climber managed to outpull gravity and reach the mountain's peak.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's incredible strength allowed him to outpull any villain he faced.

meanings.definition: To exceed in pulling or drawing out.
meanings.sent1: The magician's trick was to outpull a never-ending string of colorful scarves from his sleeve.
meanings.sent2: The farmer had to outpull the weeds from the garden to ensure his crops could grow.
meanings.sent3: The race car driver tried to outpull the other cars on the track to take the lead.
meanings.sent4: The vacuum cleaner managed to outpull all the dirt and dust from the carpet.
meanings.sent5: The determined student was able to outpull all his classmates in the game of tug-of-war.
